node.title: Police warn of "reports of aggressive fox encounters" near U.S. Capitol
node.description: "For your safety, please do not approach any foxes," police warned.
node.content: ["Police in Washington, D.C. warned Tuesday that there's a new threat lurking near the Capitol building: foxes.\u00a0", "The U.S. Capitol Police said there have been \"several reports of aggressive fox encounters\" at or near the Capitol building, adding that animal control officers are working to trap and relocate the creatures.\u00a0", "\"For your safety, please do not approach any foxes,\" police warned.\u00a0", "We have received several reports of aggressive fox encounters on or near the grounds of the U.S. Capitol.", "For your safety, please do not approach any foxes.", "Animal Control Officers are working to trap and relocate any foxes they find.", "On Monday, Mitch McConnell's press secretary tweeted an image of an alert sent to the Senate community warning of potential fox dens on Capitol grounds. The note said Capitol police received multiple reports of people being \"attacked or bitten\" by a fox, with one encounter occurring near the Botanic Garden and another on the House side of the Capitol.\u00a0", "\"Foxes are wild animals that are very protective of their dens and territory,\" the note said. \"Please do not approach any fox you see.\"\u00a0", "Congresswoman Virginia Foxx retweeted the image with a joke, writing, \"So much for my 'Fox Caucus' idea\u2026\"\u00a0", "Fox News pic.twitter.com/jA9CrWMChf", "The reports of \"aggressive\" fox encounters appear to contradict the species' typical behavior. Foxes are generally afraid of humans and are much more likely to run away than attack, according to the Humane Society.\u00a0", "The Humane Society said foxes are typically not a danger to humans unless they are rabid, or if they have been captured or handled \u2014 though it noted that foxes raised in urban areas may associate people with food and act more boldly. The foxes may attack small pets, however, especially if the pets have come near their young or are small enough to be considered prey.\u00a0", "To scare a fox away, the Humane Society recommends making loud noises, dousing them with water or throwing a small object at them.\u00a0", "Spotted outside the Capitol: a red fox. I was sitting at a gazebo outside the Russell Senate Office building when this little one came trotting up. Then galloped after a squirrel pic.twitter.com/xrX4sMi9XU", "Victoria Albert is a Sr. News Editor at CBS News. Reach her at victoria.albert@viacomcbs.com"]
